thread.title: Trail Blazers vs. Sacramento Kings: Game preview
thread.title_full: Trail Blazers vs. Sacramento Kings: Game preview | OregonLive.com

author: Joe Freeman | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Trail Blazers vs. Sacramento Kings: Game preview
text:
Trail Blazers (1-1) at Kings (2-1)
7 p.m. Saturday at Sleep Train Arena
Radio on KPOJ (620) Sacramento's projected starters No. Name Height Position Statistics 9 Rajon Rondo 6-1 PG 5.3 ppg, 6.0 apg 3 Ben McLemore 6-5 SG 3.7 ppg, 1.3 rpg 8 Rudy Gay 6-8 SF 20.0 ppg, 7.3 rpg 00 Willie Cauley-Stein 7-0 PF 6.0 ppg, 6.3 rpg 15 DeMarcus Cousins 6-11 C 18.0 ppg, 8.3 rpg
Portland's projected starters No. Name Height Position Statistics 0 Damian Lillard 6-3 PG 19.5 ppg, 3.0 apg, 3.5 rpg 3 CJ McCollum 6-4 SG 14.5 ppg, 4.5 apg 8 Al-Farouq Aminu 6-9 SF 11.0 ppg, 8.0 rpg 11 Meyers Leonard 7-1 PF 11.0 ppg, 7.0 rpg 24 Mason Plumlee 6-11 C 7.5 ppg, 6.5 rpg
About the Blazers: Portland claimed its first win of the exhibition season on Thursday, defeating the Golden State Warriors 118-101. Eleven players scored and nine recorded an assist as the Blazers showcased impressive depth, crisp passing and continual movement. ... Allen Crabbe made 9 of 12 shots, including 5 of 6 three-pointers, and recorded 25 points, the most he's scored in a Blazers uniform. ... The Blazers scored 77 poins in the first half, when they shot 52 percent from the field, including 47 percent from three-point range. ... Lillard was cold all night, making just 3 of 18 shots, but he was able to draw plenty of fouls, making 15 free throws. He tweaked his left ankle late in the third quarter, but the injury is considered minor. Lillard, who hates skipping games and has never missed one in the regular season, said he would consider sitting out an exhibition game if needed. ... Aminu, who missed the exhibition opener because his wife was in labor, made his Blazers debut against the Warriors. He started at small forward and finished with 11 points and eight rebounds in 25 minutes. ... If you remove Lillard's 3-for-18 shooting night, the Blazers made 36 of 70 shots (51 percent). ... Forward Moe Harkless did not practice Friday as he continued his recovery from a Wednesday concussion.
About the Kings: Sacramento defeated the San Antonio Spurs 95-92 on Thursday at Sleep Train Arena. Gay recorded 27 points and seven rebounds and Cousins added 17 points and 10 rebounds. ... The Kings defeated the Blazers 109-105 in overtime Monday night in Portland during the exhibition opener for both teams. ... Cauley-Stein has started the last two games for the Kings after coming off the bench against the Blazers. The rookie lottery pick from Kentucky is averaging 6.0 points, 7.0 rebounds and 2.0 blocks as a starter.
Injuries: For Portland, guard Gerald Henderson (left hip) is out and Harkless (concussion) is questionable. The Kings are not reporting any injuries.
-- Joe Freeman | jfreeman@oregonian.com | 503-294-5183 | @BlazerFreeman
